text:
Hi Guys!

`module.js` file is included in `module.html` file automatically. But I need to load it manually from template. How can I do that? I know how to load it manually, but how to tell HubSpot not to include `module.js` file on the page automatically?
enterprise and maybe professional have a membership <https://www.HubSpot.com/product-updates/create-membership-content-using-marketing-hub>

Please let me know if there's a better place to ask this. I am trying to create a custom module for an email that allows for someone to select a specific blog post from a dropdown and have the title, description, and featured image populate as part of the email in a specific format. I've seen ways to have an RSS feed populate, but I want to be able to select one.
I know it works for regular modules, but you the field "page" I believe it is called

you would make the script only fire on some kind of instance. So you would either take the JS out of the module and put it in a global style sheet, using some kind of if statement to fire

or

you write an if statement in your module JS file to only fire based upon the condition you are looking for
So...: I have no idea what you are trying to do. What condition you are trying to make your include happen
What are you trying to do
Why do you need to do what you think you need to do
What’s your goal
I need to add the script directly in module.html file. To pass some hubl variables into javascript directly
I don't want to use global `window` namespace to pass hubl data to javascript
Yeah
This bid more in depth than you are letting in
Is
You also aren’t describing what you are trying to do
Can you rewind back band explain what you are doing , what isn’t working, and what your goal is?
I said that I am trying to pass Hubl variables into javascript files, what else should I describe :slightly_smiling_face:
Yes I can
So look
in `module.html` file
Then I access the `window.__site_header_module__` in my Javascript file `module.js`
But this way of sharing data with javascript scope - is absolutely wrong. It's working well, but the solution is bad cause you share data with global space

But to achieve that, I'm trying to figure out how to

1) delete default `module.js` include in template (Don't know how to do that)
2) load the `module.js` file manually using `require.js` (Done :heavy_check_mark:)
